column4: can anyone tell me how to log in as root user and then back to normal user ?
use 'sudo -s' to switch to root user, CTRL-D to go back
http://www.ubuntulinux.org/wiki/UniversePackages

NTFS only has read support. Otherwise there is no hassle.
then there should be no worries :)
you user will be able to write to the partition :)
mount -t vfat -o umask=000 /dev/hdXX /mnt/point
space between hda5 and /mnt
you must unmount it first
ok, something uses it. try 'lsof /mnt/E'
close all windows of E first if you haven't
how about that 'lsof /mnt/E'? :)
no, you have to edit the /etc/fstab file
sudo gedit /etc/fstab
then add: /dev/hdaX /mnt/point vfat defaults,umask=000 0 0
for both partitions. Leave an empty line at the bottom.
